comments.body: This would make the basalt delta more useful, as you can kill magma cubes for fuel.

It’s surprising that the nether has hardly any fuel sources that don’t require having iron and using buckets. When made myself start in the nether, it was difficult to get any other fuel source besides sticks. Magma blocks would make sense, and would be useful as a lesser fuel compared to lava
This would give magma blocks more use and magma cream more use as well.

This will not help at all. Why don't we just add optiols for all changed features? For the hunger bar? That was a big controversy back then.

Minecraft needs to look to the future, not go back on their decisions. This is not a suitable compromise.
What the heck Erik Svensson, this is not at all comparable in scale to the addition of the hunger bar... I actually think signs should have the plank texture by default but I'll still vote!
I think it only needs a higher knockback

i think instead the recipe should give you eight stairs instead of just four. just like what you were saying, right now it costs six full blocks to make to make four stairs, (or 3/4 of a block,) which equals half the original six blocks in volume.
exactly !

. This idea doesn't add either new. For an emerald variant to the enchanting to be using it should differ from the original. Firstly if it is better than the current enchanting table it should use obsidian, maybe instead of that, it could be a material that is difficult to find the nether (see the nether lacks content so the table would be adding content there). Secondly, the table should be different from the original. Maybe instead of enchantments, it gives curses. These curses could be a buffed or alternated version of existing enchantments but with a drawback (for example a buffed Protection I + Cursing of Binding or a version of Fire Resistance which allows you to swim in lava for 10 seconds + Curse of Vanishing). 

The player can get better or new enchantments at the price of a random curse
I don't see the how this could be. That's like saying you put 2 Enchantment Tables next to each other I'm sorry to say.
Bad idea. We already have leather chestplates WHICH YOU CAN DYE.

Hi, can you explain what you're looking for this to add? Sorry, this feedback isn't specific enough.

Please remember to put more context in your posts, including "how they work" and "why they're needed". 

https://feedback.minecraft.net/hc/en-us/articles/360012134952-How-to-Post-and-Edit-Feedback

We want to help everyone have their ideas succeed. Thanks for your contribution.
it could be used to increase your inventory slots and be used as a improved leather chestplate with extra durability and and extra armour slots due to the long sleeves
Leather Chestplate.
Do you mean that sand should not fall when touching a slime block?
Bilbo Baggins yep
Makes sense.

Maybe we could expand on this. Putting a slime block and a gravity-affected block (sand, gravel, concrete powder) could create the sticky variation of that block. It wouldn't look very different from a regular block of that type, but when you mine it, it will drop the block and a couple of slimeballs.

If the golem attacks the player without the player provoking them,

1. Why would a player create this in the first place

2. If a player did decide to create it, how could they create it without getting immediately attacked afterward?
I agree with @Gametron 13. What is the point of creating the golem in survival mode?
For practice, you can test yourself on the black iron golem.
To be honest im thinking the black iron golem is for pillagers like how the iron golem is for villagers but dark iron golems are a enemy in pillager fortress
im voting but only cuz it seemed like you put a LOT of effort into this.
I think this system could make cauldrons more useful.
I use gold tools in survival.  They are very useful already.  I don’t think they need any more power.
They already get better enchantments, so I don't know what this suggestion is supposed to be. Also, for once we agree on something, Bilbo.
Possibly, collecting spawners with golden Silk Touch picks? A special Silk Touch 2 enchantment specifically for spawners?

Can't say I'm a fan of making it so that only gold can mine it. Why would people go out of their way to make a gold pickaxe just for this? Though gold needs more use, I don't think this is the way to do it.

I like the idea, but I think it might be a bit overpowered. Unless it is incompatible with redstone.... then I could see this being balanced.
Why do we need this?
I see maybe useful in something like the survival test but otherwise not efficient enough to be crafted.
Hey, dude, anyways you are faster than any mob, except maybe for Baby Zombies, just Run, and I don’t know, use a regular sword?
Cool idea but I don’t see much of a use for it as wood swords are easily available and plus you are already getting wood for the sticks
No way.  I have never heard of a dirt sword.  (I have never heard of a diamond sword either, though)
This is kinda goofy, WHICH IS WHY ME NEED IT!

How it is supposed to work ? (I mean how do you set commands in it and how do you set the first and the last ?).

And could you be more precise whith the interest of this new block because everything you said is already possible with actuals commands :

- in your post, /tp $playerName 0 64 0 = /tp @p 0 64 0

- and for the /say, it is possible with a /say, but I'll use a /tellraw : /tellraw @a [{"text":"Hi "},{"selector":"@p"}] - for a /say, tape /say *selector*

You can even make a player speak : /tellraw @a [{"text":"<"},{"selector":"@p"},{"text":">  Hi "},{"selector":"@a"}]

We already have loops with the functions.

However, if we could give a player's head with a selector (I don't know how to explain it) with this command : /give @p player_head{Owner:$PlayerName} ,that could be useful.
Note : the last command is supposed to give the head of the nearest player.
That's what skeletons are for, and also, zombies already have a chance to spawn with iron swords or iron shovels.
Daylight sensors are exactly the same thing.
I'd like solar panels and wind farms and hydroelectric dams.
please do this. I want this added to Minecraft
*nether

Eh...  I guess they aren’t poisonous, since we use them to make potions that we then consume, but something about the brewing process could also denature the poison.  It’s an interesting idea, but I don’t imagine they would be something you would actually want to eat...
This is already available with elytra. I don't see the point of adding a potion with this.
You mean like the Potion of slow falling added in 1.13?

Additionally: Perhaps could craft a picnic basket (trapdoors, carpet, or sticks on top of the recipe) that does the same but only with food items! Would ultimately be less helpful since players typically only use one food source, but
1. Could be nice when lost/exploring and resources are sparse
2. I’m lying it would be basically useless but it would be cute and that’s why I want it
Yes Mojang We NEED this.

For the compass idea, it would be interesting if it was possible to connect compasses, like with maps, then a player would be able to find another player, as long the other player has a compass with the same connection.

Not necessarily limited to two compasses, you could have multiple ones that show all the others in the "same frequency".

But it wouldn't detect players widout compasses.

As well as only showing the player locator bar if you are holding a compass, I think only players holding an unlinked (not lodestone or recovery) compass (in hand or in hotbar, I don't know) should show up on the player locator bar.

So if two players are trying to find each other, the compasses would lead them to each other instead of to the worldspawn.
we all agree with this guys, vote!!

I think the only use for it currently is as a water basin and you can dye leather armor with it... So i agree! I'm not sure what kind of potions would be made that aren't in a brewing stand, but i think making soup with it would be really cool. Maybe either instead of crafting you make soup with the cauldron, or perhaps you can make "bulk" soup. a soup that fills your ENTIRE hunger bar and or simply gives you multiple soups at a time, each time clicking the cauldron with a bowl to get soup (8 soups per cauldron)
Netherite would be expensive AF
Snow bricks should have a higher hardness than normal snow.

This is how to craft it:

wow

better but it should be 80% for its price like  with the mace,you die if u dont hit with the mace but deal tons of damage if u do hit the target
Thats such a good idea, thank you !

I agree! we need something more available than the shulker box, especially if finding the end city isn’t your main goal in game, and I think backpacks and/or bundles are a good idea! Like it could go either in your inventory, or in one of the armor slots.
I could agree more from the comments below. Backpacking is a way of life now days so we should keep up with the NEW NORMS.
